Sean Stanton Memorial Community Slow Roll
description: The Sean Stanton Memorial Community SLOW ROLL on July 22, 2016
course: Start at City Hall parking lot at 6:30 PM, slow roll South on Washington Street to Bellows Street, head east on Bellows one block to Main Street and head South back to City Hall
registration: Registration will be on site before the event starts from 5:30 to 6: 30 PM at City Hall parking lot 320 W. broadway
notes: The Slow Roll will have police escort
directions: The parking lot behind Mt. Pleasant City Hall will be the start and finish point

address.street: Art Van Sports Complex- Merrell Trail

title: Cherry Roubaix Gran Fondo

address.street: 2786 N Garfield Rd, Traverse City, MI 49686

description: 25, 55 & 86 mile routes.  The 55 & 86 mile courses are timed.  There will be winners, but there will be no losers.
course: All racers and those touring start at the same time, 10 AM, in front of the historic State Theatre on Front Street in downtown Traverse City and finish with a mountain top climb up Herman in Sutton's Bay.  So whether you want to race or just finish you will either have a challenge to win or pay off of a great view of the Grand Traverse Bay at the top of Herman Hill.  From there it's a short downhill ride to Hop Lot in Sutton's Bay for beer, food and friends on bikes.  And if you want, walk across the street and swim, kayak, SUP in Sutton's Bay.  Bring the family, relax all Saturday afternoon.
registration: Here is the link for registration: https://events.bytepro.net/2016cherryroubaix

title: Chrono Strade Bianche and Road Race
52nd Annual Debaets-Devos Pro-Am Memorial Bicycle Race
SNAP FITNESS Alma Grand Prix of Cyclocross & 5k
Michigan Tech Collegiate Race
description:
Cross Country
The cross country course (XC), will start on the two track snowmobile trail on the west side of U.S. 41 right by town. The race will then go to the bottom of the Flow trail after crossing Brockway Mountain Drive and proceeding on the two track trail to the Flow trail. The race will then ascend the Flow trail to the top where the trail then hits Brockway Mountain Drive again. Racers will take a left onto Brockway Drive, and proceed less than ¼ mile to a right turn onto On the Edge trail. This is to avoid the cliff section of On the Edge to prevent any mishap from happening there. Take a right onto Woopidy Woo Trail and proceed until the intersection of Garden Brook, taking a left onto Garden Brook. Racers will continue on Garden Brook until the right turn for Jim Rooks trail. Proceeding on Rooks trail until the two track that will be a right turn to ascend the two track back up to Garden Brook Trail. Taking a left onto Garden Brook and continue climbing up to the Mountain Lodge. Here we will be crossing U.S. 41 to run the rest of the race course on the east side of U.S. 41 to minimize road crossings and minimize the time that an officer is needed. After racers cross 41 they will make a left turn onto Blue Trail and climb this toward the Mountain Lodge. Racers will then be directed onto Dza Beet to descend onto Here We Go. Racers will contiune on Here We Go until it turns into Der We Went. Racers will go up there Der We Went to the Ma Maki intersection and take a left onto Ma Maki. Racers will take Ma Maki a short distance to a right turn onto Say Hello. Proceeding on Say Hello until the Simeh intersection where they will then take a left turn to the De Deet intersection which will be a left turn onto De Deet. Following De Deet to Red Trail and taking a left onto Mango at the bottom of Red. B and C racers will finish their singletrack sections here and take a left onto Manganese Road at the end of Mango to head back to town for the finish in the field by the Copper Harbor Loop Trail. 
"A" racers will continue for a second lap of the singletrack by taking a left at the Mango and Ma Maki intersection. Continuing on Ma Maki to the Say Hello intersection, and taking a left onto the Say Hello Trail. From here it will be the same trails used to get to Red Trail as Lap number one. The other difference in the "A" race is at the end of Mango on lap number two racers will take a right onto Manganese Road to proceed to a left turn on the Point Trail and continuing on Pauls Plunge and back to manganese road for a finish in the Field by Copper Harbor Loop Trail. 

STXC
The Short Track course will be held at Michigan Tech Trails in Houghton MI. Each Lap will be about a mile in distance and include fast flow sections, single track, berms, corners, and ski trail. The start and finish of the course will be on a wide ski trail area to allow for space and time to spread out before the single track sections. 

Dual Slalom 
The DS course will also be held at Michigan Tech Trails in Houghton MI. The starting gate leads into banked corners, large pumps, tables, and doubles on a gradual downhill slope. 

Downhill
The Downhill race will take place on the Overflow trail. Racers will be given the option for A or B lines. The course will start up the road just a bit from the Overflow intersection. The ambulance will be on site at the bottom on M-26 for the race. Practice runs with shuttles will be provided. Two race workers will be stationed at the top to assist the USA Cycling official with starting racers.
directions:
Cross Country Race- Copper Harbor
Downhill Race - Copper Harbor
Short Track- Michigan Tech Trails
Dual Slalom - Michigan Tech Trails

title: Waterloo G & G
description: Join us on Sunday, October 23 for a preview ride of Waterloo G & G. We will leave from Portage Lake in Waterloo State Rec Area at 10:30 AM and all riders and bikes are welcome! The course (the same route as last March’s race; see Course Maps) will be marked, with limited support. This ride is strictly non competitive: no race shirts, no medals, no prizes, no fuss. Just a great autumn ride out in fabulous scenery! The cost of our preview ride is $10 plus any voluntary donation you’d like to give to help cover the cost of insurance, route marking, course support, etc. Additional donations will be given to support the Karen McKeachie memorial scholarship.
course: This is a 29.99 mi Bike Ride in Michigan Center, MI, United States. The Bike Ride has a total ascent of 1082.42 ft and has a maximum elevation of 1,161.25 ft.
